Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JAI_Chander
Reviews.Content: The location is very good. few minutes walk to sea front Bosporus and the bridge view . Hotel is not so good for International travelers. rooms keys were a problem not opening. It was one day stay for me on the way back to India from Bursa. Getting to the hotel from Yenni Kappi by the Hotel pick up van took almost 2 hrs due to traffic jam. Ok for Biz . far off from other tourist place . except the Bridge. Complimentary Break fast was good.near the pool side over looking the bridge . Nice view and pool was neat.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel after renovation”
Reviews.Author: salih02
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night only during a business trip in Istanbul and I was very pleased by the fine breakfast, clean rooms and wonderful Bosphorus view. I learned that they have undergone a major renovation recently and the hotel became a much nicer place. I do not know the old one but the one I saw was very good. The hotel is located in one of the the most beautiful districts in Istanbul: OrtakÃ¶y. Its location alone is a big plus for the hotel. But if you would like to visit the historical city center, which is Sultanahmet and its surroundings (TopkapÄ± Palace, Basilica Sistern, St. Sophia, Grand Bazaar, etc.) this hotel is a little far from them. If you will stay in this hotel, ask for the rooms which views the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bridge View”
Reviews.Author: Mellotune
Reviews.Content: The elevators are quite slow, so be prepared to take the stairs.The rooms are average. The buffet breakfast was average but the view from the restaurant is great. You can see the bridge very closely. Great photo spot. There is a convenience store across the street from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Low cost: 20 TL from centre ( on a good day)”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyAsbestos
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel in the wrong place! However itis a lot cheaper than hotels with a bospheros vew. It is only 5 mins walk away, but the view fro this hotel is much more pedestrian. However the staff are really good, in spite of my key not working every time the bell hop always opened the door for me. bereakfast is typical of the region, very enjoyable too. Rooms at front of house are a little noisy, traffic and Muezzin too! Otherwise good value and not far from local suk with plenty of good value restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Free Wifi only redeaming factor....”
Reviews.Author: madflyer
Reviews.Content: While I could write a very long review as was put at this hotel for 4 nights and saw lots of flaws, the main problem is that it is in no way geared toward international guests. I think many of the domestic travelers were actually happy with this property. The rooms are ok if you are lucky. We had mixed bag as we were several rooms and many were not satisfied at all. The breakfast was terrible compared with other experiences in Istanbul. Would never rate this hotel above a 3 star and would not recomend it in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the main advantage”
Reviews.Author: guru52
Reviews.Content: This old hotel is very well located in Otorkoy area near Bosphorus bridge joining continents of Europe and Asia. Although rooms are ok, they are quite old and this hotel needs a renovation. Being right on a crowded road lot of noise comes to the room and night sleep may not be peaceful. Nothing great to write about this hotel except the location.

Reviews.Title: “quite good value but certainly not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: MikeAnnette
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located and the staff were friendly but the rooms are very tired and the beds were woeful. It is certainly not what you would expect from a 4 star hotel but the actual value compared to the well known chain hotels in Istanbul was not bad....just don't expect much.I had a room close to the lift and the incessant noise was bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: Life101
Reviews.Content: What was a nicely laid out advert about this so called Hotel ...is all but a sham!. They do not deserve a start let alone the so called 4 or 5 stars they claim to be. We arrived at the Hotel and were directed to our room which was a like a 5x5 Shell we compalined and advised that this was not what was shown while we made the booking with booking.com So after a few hours of telling us they are totally sold out the front desk guy manages to pull out a slightly bigger room but the air con was not working and the temp was around the higher 70's we complained agian and told the Duty Manager we don't have baby cot nor is the aircon working ....he said he will give us something tommorow....and that the so called air con was at maxmum and that they don't have central A/C and its only an air blower with little cooling....we were flabergasted .....two kids crying their lungs out coz they can't sleep coz the room temprature was impossible to sleep in .....so they finally managed to get another room after I told the duty manager we are leaving the dump!!! so he comes back after an hour and finds us a room which was in no way cooling ...but the kds were tired and had to sleep ....woke up in the morning to find out my daughters bedding was wet of sweat she was complaining of headache we thought it was just her being tired ...after breakfast we had to rush her to to the Hospital cause she had thrown up everthing she ate........she was sick due to the horrible room she stayed in....we have hospital bill as well. after our return from the Hospital I demanded the Manager to get me a room that works with an A/C that cools ...he then informs he ( and i have this on video) that since yesterday their AC has not been working and its only been the fan from the vents... Needless to say we stormed out of this pathetic Property paid them for one night of a horrible experince and checked ourself into the Ceylan Intercon where both my kids are finally getting some peaceful sleep with proper aircon and facilities. In summary they are liars they will show you a nice room on booking they will not give you that room, they will not admit they are having problems with their infrastructure...they have really OLD OLD OLD outdated furrniture and fittings.....see some pics attached>> AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE THE PLAGUE IF TRIP ADVSIOR KEEPS THIS HOTEL ON THEIR LIST OF PROPERTIES THEN TRIP ADVSIOR SHOULD HAVE A HEADING TO INFORM PEOPLE THIS IS A PROPERTY THAT SHOULD BE IN HELL

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but not trying to be better”
Reviews.Author: Shuttie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as looking for a cheaper option than those more popular names like Conrad and Swissotel. It is shown as a 5 Star, and boasts free wifi access across the hotel, as well as a 'rock cafe' bar. My room was spacious, clean, and well maintained - in fact one of the better quality rooms, even when compared to the big names.... but it is not 5 Star quality. The Wifi was very poor in the room, but worked great in the lobby bar. Breakfast was a nice spread, and no complaints. The only staff who tried to make some conversation was the barmen... the rest were polite but made no effort to be anything more. I ate in the lobby bar a couple of times, and I have to say the food was great. Definetly recommend the steaks. The local village is bussling with bars and restaurants, and well worth a visit. You get to see the full size of the road bridge. I am afraid to say that despite being slightly cheaper that its main rivals I wont be staying here again. If it was closer to a ferry point (our office is on the Asian side of Istanbul), then I might consider it. They really need to try a little harder.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: InfiniteHorizon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in Feb 2009. The location is pretty good, but not if you are a tourist as the main tourist area of Sultanahmet (monuments etc.) is quite far. The exterior is not so great, looks more like an office / apartment block. The staff are friendly and prompt however their English skills are limited. There were times when it took nearly an hour to get the dish I ordered from room service! The interiors are well done although a bit dark. The room was a bit small but the amenities were clean and well maintained. The terrace restaurant is the best â€“ you can see the Bosphorus Bridge as the hotel is practically located below it. There is a small pool too. Breakfast (buffet style) at the terrace restaurant was included â€“ nice selection of fruits although the menu tends to be repetitive / boring. Overall, I would give it a thumbs up for a short stay â€“ definitely for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “What do you want???”
Reviews.Author: garymv
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel for the past 12 years without any real issues.......what you have to decide before you travel is what you want from the trip.... 5* Facilities for 3 star money? you wont get that here..........Or a hotel which you can put up with to gain a great location for sightseeing without having to drive anywhere....... I can see the point of some of the people regarding the hotel looking tired but whoever paid 150 euros a night.........thats laughable. It really isnt that bad!

Reviews.Title: “well positioned for nightlife, however really needs a face lift badly”
Reviews.Author: teny
Reviews.Content: spent 2 nights in this hotel on 10th june, from other reviews we did not expect anything special. we chose the hotel as it is well positioned for nightlife and shopping in ortakoy. we were not disappointed by the hotel position, as we could walk to some great clubs and restaurants. staff we friendly enough, our rooms were fine for a city hotel (we were upgraded to triple rooms and one was very large). however for the price we paid the hotel was very average. this did not spoil our stay. But compared to our stay in a similar priced hotel in sultanahmet this hotel faired poorly. Breakfast was poor, we did not bother going on the 2nd morning. I did have a small personal item stolen from my room, and the reception staff were not particulary interested since coming home i have emailed the manager, and he has not even bothered to reply to my email, i found this unusual as anywhere else we went in istanbul the service has been excellent. we did use the hairdressers which was great for a wash and blowdry and manicure, it did not look wonderful but turned out to be a very pleasant surprise. the pool area was nice and a lovely way to relax after a hard days shopping one strange thing in the entrance to the hotel was an airport style security walk through machine, it was unusual in the entrance of a hotel, but even more unusual was that it bleeped everytime we walked through it (both going in and out of the hotel) and nobody said anything or checked us - why was it there??????? all in all i dont really recommend the hotel as being wonderful, but the position is good, it just depends really on what is more important to you for your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and dated hotel”
Reviews.Author: familyholidayz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Princess Ortakoy at the beginning of May 2008 with our toddler. The hotel clearly had grand aspirations when it was built but it had become very tired and needed to be updated. Within 15 minutes of our arrival, we had a power cut in our room. The electrician came straight away but I have to say it was not a great start. Our room was located on the third floor (304) and overlooked the main street which was really noisy. As we were heading out for the evening we thought it would quieten down by the time we returned but the road was just as busy at midnight as it had been in the day time! We ended up calling reception and told them we wanted to move to a quite room in the morning. In the morning we were informed the room was not ready but if we packed our bags they would move us to a quiter room by the afternoon. We finally ended up in a room on the fourth floor (426) which was spacious and very quiet. Breakfast was very good and the view of the long bridge linking Europe to Asia was impressive. The views from the pool were good too. But we found eveything in the hotel really expensive. Don't bother using the minibar, or ordering anything from the menu, waste of money. The only reason we stayed at the hotel was because we were attending a wedding, otherwise we would have remained in our original hotels in Sultanammet (Stone Hotel & Ada Hotel).

Reviews.Title: “extremly overpriced, maximum 2 stars”
Reviews.Author: isisis
Reviews.Content: you can get many nicer hotels with less price so make a search before you book, can of cola 6 euro, cup of tea 4 euro, that was like a nightmare, furniture carpets old very old, trust me do not waste your money if you looking for a 5 star hotel, ortakoy is a very nice place of istanbul, so look for any other hotel but not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, Dirty, Staff with Attention Deficit Disorder”
Reviews.Author: RafBenN
Reviews.Content: This hotel hasnt been touched since the early eighties. If you like flourescent lighting, and the musty smell of tobacco in the carpets then you'll love this place, especially if you want to spend EUR 150 for the pleasure. The rooms are spacious enough, but mine was near the lift and the door was paper thin so i heard the beep of the lift all night. However maybe if they were smaller they would be able to clean them better. I ordered a tuna sandwhich and salad on room service. First they couldnt understand my order. Then reception called to say they werent sure if they have chicken fish. Then they brought the salad with no dressing, when i called for them to bring some, they brought two grimey bottles of oil and lemon juice to my room and waited for me to apply them because they had no more in the hotel and needed the grimey bottles back. I asked for directions to a meeting and the receptionist told me it was 50 metres away. I needed to ask about 5 times because every time he would listen for about 5 seconds then move onto something more important, like talking to the security guard. It turned out to be a 35 minute taxi ride so i was late. if you need shelter and this is the only hotel available, go for it. Otherwise dont bother.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel so-so, but neighborhood nice”
Reviews.Author: frank2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for a week in May 2007. It was ok for the company-negotiated rate of 88 dollars for a single room. The hotel embodies the charme of the 80s and could do with an overhaul. My room was rather spacious and had a nice view of the long bridge connecting Asia with Europe. The bathroom was a little shabby and smelly. A big plus is the neighborhood. Within walking distance you will find many restaurants facing the Bosphorus and a number of modern clubs and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: loulish
Reviews.Content: Small/miduem hotel it has 5 floors and quite rooms. I would give it 3 1/2 stars. It's an old hotel with old furniture, it's clean and well kept. Service is very helpful, food is good. The hall-ways are not light all the time, as you walk in to the hall a motion detector will turn on the lights. (all except the first floor) When you come in to the hotel there is a metal detector and a luggage scanner. (this was a bit scary) It's close to: Synagogue and the restaurant (Karne).

HotelInfo.Name: Ortakoy Princess Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Dereboyu Caddesi. no.10, Ortakoy, Istanbul 80840, Turkey
